characters.name: Blue Bobbin
characters.description: A Rarity For You salespony in The Saddle Row Review and Fake It 'Til You Make It. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as a helper during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. Her bio states, "This 'Rarity for You' shop-pony knows WAY more about organza than Rainbow Dash. Granted, that's a pretty low bar." Her cutie mark is a spool of blue thread. Voiced by Caitlyn Bairstow.

characters.name: Butternut
characters.description: An acorn farmer who appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever as Oak Nut's wife and Pistachio's mother. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game; her bio states, "The proud proprietress of Sweet Acorn Orchard -- along with her husband -- Butternut is always thankful to meet someone who can help inspire her son." Voiced by Ingrid Nilson.

characters.name: Charity Kindheart
characters.description: A Bridleway costume designer and founder of the Midsummer Theatre Revival in Made in Manehattan. Her cutie mark is a heart-shaped pincushion. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Watch as she whips up her costumes with flair, restoring the theater so that art can be shared."

characters.name: Cheerilee

characters.name: Hoofer Steps

characters.name: Junebug
characters.description: See Junebug.

characters.name: Lighthoof
characters.description: A student/cheerleader at the School of Friendship in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat. Her cutie mark is a horseshoe and two pompoms. Voiced by Kelli Ogmundson.

characters.name: Orange Slice
characters.description: A Whinnyapolis tourist and Chargrill Breadwinner's wife in Spice Up Your Life. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, and Grannies Gone Wild. Her cutie mark is an orange slice. Voiced by Enid-Raye Adams.

characters.name: Photo Finish
characters.description: See Photo Finish.

characters.name: Prim Hemline
characters.description: See Prim Hemline.

characters.name: Professor Fossil
characters.description: Appears in Shadow Play - Part 1 and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place as the professor of an archaeological dig at Rockhoof's island home. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a pickaxe and rock. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #19 C lists her name with a trademark symbol and states, "A more cautious archeologist than some others, Professor Fossil still has strong opinions about what belongs in a museum." Voiced by Kelli Ogmundson.

characters.name: Roma
characters.description: See Roma.

characters.name: Sapphire Shores
characters.description: See Sapphire Shores.

characters.name: Shimmy Shake
characters.description: A student/cheerleader at the School of Friendship in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat. Her cutie mark is a gust of wind and two pompoms. Voiced by Diana Kaarina. Shares her name with Twist's mother in the original version of Smile Song.

characters.name: Spoiled Rich
characters.description: See Spoiled Rich.

characters.name: Trapeze Star
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus as a trapeze/magic artist in Ponet Fantastique. Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Her cutie mark is a trapeze bar and several blue stars. Voiced by Zara Durrani. Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria #54 C Trapeze Star, Acrobatic Magic quotes, "Acrobats and magicians are a dime a dozen... But have you ever seen an acrobat pull a rabbit out of a hat?! I donâ€™t think so!"

characters.name: Tree Hugger
characters.description: See Tree Hugger.

characters.name: Mrs. Trotsworth
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done?, Road to Friendship, and Daring Do and the Marked Thief of Marapore as the owner and caretaker of the Get On Inn. In The Marked Thief of Marapore, she is described as a unicorn. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Janyse Jaud.

characters.name: Wrangler
characters.description: Appears in Fluttershy Leans In as an expert animal herder. Shares her design with "Yuma Spurs", S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #9, and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #14. Her cutie mark is a lasso. Voiced by Kazumi Evans. Also mentioned on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #54 page 2. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Conductor
All Aboard
characters.description: See Friendship Express train conductors.

characters.name: Big Bucks
characters.description: Appears in Grannies Gone Wild as one of a pair of Las Pegasus magicians, with Jack Pot. Also appears in Between Dark and Dawn. His cutie mark is a white star and black top hat. Voiced by Tariq Leslie.

characters.name: Big Daddy McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts and Fluttershy Leans In as the patriarch of the McColt family. Shares his structure and eye color with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #11, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #14, and Short Fuse. Voiced by Peter Kelamis. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Big McIntosh
characters.description: See Big McIntosh.

characters.name: Braeburn
characters.description: See Braeburn.

characters.name: Buried Lede
characters.description: A Manehattan newspaper columnist in The Saddle Row Review. Listed by name within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom. Shares his chin style and mustache style with Whiplash. Shares his coat and mane colors and somewhat design with "Heisenbuck". His cutie mark is a pencil and pad. Resembles J. Jonah Jameson from the Spider-Man comics. Voiced by Alan Marriot.

characters.name: Burnt Oak
characters.description: A firewood salespony and an old friend of Bright Mac's in The Perfect Pear. Also appears in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Big Mac Question, and The Last Problem. Somewhat similar to the Stranger. Burnt Oak and Young Burnt Oak are characters in Gameloft's mobile game, with Young Burnt Oak serving as a boss battle helper during "The Pinkie Parents Problem." Young Burnt Oak's bio states, "Back in his younger days, this aspiring firewood salespony used to hang out with Bright Mac all the time" His cutie mark is a burnt oak branch. Voiced by Bill Mondy.

characters.name: Cattail
characters.description: Appears in A Health of Information and My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #58 as a descendant of Mage Meadowbrook. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, and The Last Problem. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "This descendant of the famous Mage Meadowbrook may not have the reputation of his legendary ancestor, but he does have the accent." Shares his body design with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, Stinky Bottom, "Leadnail McColt", S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, "Port Wine", Coriander Cumin, and "Mint Condition". His cutie mark is a sun spiral and two crossed cattail stalks. Voiced by Doron Bell.

characters.name: Chargrill Breadwinner
characters.description: A Whinnyapolis tourist and Orange Slice's husband in Spice Up Your Life. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, and Grannies Gone Wild. His cutie mark is a grill. Voiced by Jim Miller.

characters.name: Cheese Sandwich
characters.description: See Cheese Sandwich.

characters.name: Code Red
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie; voiced by Adam Bengis, thanks to Beth Gowers at the Make-A-Wish Foundation of New Jersey. See also Stellar Eclipse, Angel Wings, and S07E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1.

characters.name: Double Diamond
characters.description: See Double Diamond.

characters.name: Grub Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as the founding member of the Hooffield family.

characters.name: Hard Hat
characters.description: Appears in Fluttershy Leans In as a construction pony for Fluttershy's sanctuary project. Also appears in Honest Apple. Mentioned on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #54 page 2 and Issue #73 page 3. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "When it comes to construction, his skills are the pinnacle -- though his designs can be just a bit clinical." Shares his design, eye color, and construction equipment with "Rivet" and his body type, mane and tail style, eye color, and construction equipment design with S05E10 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #4. His cutie mark is a yellow hard hat. Voiced by Mark Gibbon.

characters.name: Hoity Toity
characters.description: See Hoity Toity.

characters.name:
Mayor of Baltimare
Mayor Baltimare
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as the mayor of Baltimare arguing with the mayor of Fillydelphia. Somewhat resembles "Wacky Hair Day and Spray". His cutie mark is a gray-feathered bird. Voiced by Scott Underwood. He is listed sometimes by name in A Royal Problem's broadcast script, but he is otherwise listed simply as "Mayor of Baltimare" rather than by name; his name follows the same pattern as Queen Trottingham.

characters.name:
Mayor of Fillydelphia
Mayor Cream Cheese
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as the mayor of Fillydelphia arguing with the mayor of Baltimare. His cutie mark is a Philadelphia cheesesteak. Voiced by Tony Alcantar. The mayor of Baltimare addresses him by name in A Royal Problem and its locked script, but he is otherwise listed simply as "Mayor of Fillydelphia" rather than by name; his name references Philadelphia cream cheese.

characters.name: Oak Nut
characters.description: An acorn farmer who appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever as Butternut's husband and Pistachio's father. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "The proud proprietor of Sweet Acorn Orchard -- along with his wife -- Oak Nut is always happy to welcome new guests from out of town." His cutie mark is an acorn plant. Voiced by Garry Chalk.

characters.name: Piles McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as the founding member of the McColt family. Shares his tail style and beard style with Ginger Beard.

characters.description: See Quibble Pants.

characters.description: Appears in Frenemies as the guardian of Mt. Everhoof. Voiced by Scott Underwood.

characters.name: Sans Smirk
characters.description: Appears in The Last Laugh as the vice-president (later manager) of Cheese Sandwich's Amusement Factory. His cutie mark is a wet blanket. Voiced by Jesse Inocalla.

Street Merchant
Stinky Bottom
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan as a hat merchant. Mentioned in The Saddle Row Review and Rollercoaster of Friendship. Listed as "Hat Merchant" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom. Shares his body type with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, "Leadnail McColt", S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, "Port Wine", Coriander Cumin, "Mint Condition", and Cattail. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states "A bratty Manehattan hatter who's a real hater of nattier hats than his. (Try saying THAT three times fast!)" His cutie mark is a top hat. Voiced by Mark Oliver.

characters.description: See Svengallop.

characters.description: Appears in Forever Filly and Yakity-Sax as a balloon animal maker. His cutie mark is two balloons.

Her cutie mark is a sewing machine.

characters.name: Magdalena
characters.description: Present at the Apple family reunion in Friendship is Magic, part 1 and also appears in Green Isn't Your Color, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, and Apple Family Reunion. Seen with a light orange mane in Friendship is Magic, part 2. Identical to Red Gala in all but mane color, shares the same design, eye color, and cutie mark as "Sundowner", and shares the same design as Apple Cobbler and S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Her cutie mark is three cupcakes with green frosting and apple slices.

characters.name: Peachy Sweet
characters.description: See Peachy Sweet.

characters.name: Perfect Pie
characters.description: See Perfect Pie.

characters.name: Red Gala
characters.description: See Red Gala.

characters.name: Sundowner
characters.description: A member of the Apple family present at the reunion in Friendship is Magic, part 1. Also appears in Green Isn't Your Color, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, and Magical Mystery Cure. Shares the same design, cutie mark, and eye color as Red Gala and "Magdalena", and shares the same design as Apple Cobbler and S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Her cutie mark is three cupcakes with green frosting and apple slices.

characters.name:
Applejack's father
Bright Mac
characters.description: See Bright Mac and Pear Butter.

characters.name:
Pinkie Pie's father
Igneous Rock Pie
characters.description: See Igneous Rock Pie and Cloudy Quartz.

characters.name:
Granny Smith's father
Pokey Oaks
characters.description: Granny Smith's father, seen in Family Appreciation Day in a flashback, kissing Princess Celestia's hoof in front of his wife; in Apple Family Reunion in photos; in Bats! in a flashback; andâ€”with the top of his head bandaged and his hoof in a slingâ€”in Leap of Faith in the present, in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1 in a flashback to Leap of Faith, and in Where the Apple Lies. His cutie mark is an acorn and four other seeds.

characters.name: Stinkin' Rich
characters.description: Diamond Tiara's great-grandfather pony, instrumental in the founding of Ponyville. Appears in a sepia flashback in Family Appreciation Day; mentioned in Where the Apple Lies and on the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #30 pages 4 and 15 and Issue #31 pages 10, 15, and 19; and featured with Granny Smith on Enterplay trading card series 2 #26. His cutie mark is a cent sign.

characters.name: Apple Cinnamon
characters.description: See Apple Cinnamon.

characters.name: Apple Core
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear as a member of the Apple family. Shares his design with "Happy Trails" and S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and his cutie mark with Apple Munchies and Apple Cider. His cutie mark is three apple cores.

characters.name: Apple Split
characters.description: See Apple Split.

characters.name: Bushel
characters.description: See Bushel.

characters.name: Golden Delicious
characters.description: See Golden Delicious.

characters.name: Half Baked Apple
characters.description: See Half Baked Apple.

characters.name: Happy Trails
characters.description: A member of Granny Smith's family, seen in flashbacks in Family Appreciation Day, Apple Family Reunion, Leap of Faith, and No Second Prances, and in a photo on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #6 page 5. Shares his design with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and "Apple Core". His cutie mark is three horseshoes.

characters.name: Hayseed Turnip Truck
characters.description: See Hayseed Turnip Truck.

characters.name: Prairie Tune
characters.description: A member of Granny Smith's family, seen in flashbacks in Family Appreciation Day, Apple Family Reunion, and Leap of Faith. His cutie mark is a banjo with two musical notes.

characters.name: Red Delicious
characters.description: See Red Delicious.

characters.name: Uncle Orange
characters.description: See Aunt and Uncle Orange.

characters.name: Wensley
characters.description: See Wensley.

characters.name: Amaranthine
characters.description: Appears in Hearth's Warming Eve, both before and during the pageant performance. Also appears in flashback in Shadow Play - Part 2.

characters.name:
Builder Pony
Ambrosia
characters.description: Construction worker from The Mysterious Mare Do Well, Pinkie Pride, Fluttershy Leans In, Between Dark and Dawn, and 2, 4, 6, Greaaat. Shares her coat and eye colors and cutie mark with Gala Appleby. Her cutie mark is three apple slices. She is a character called "Builder Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This hard-working mare is more chic than you'd think: When she wears a hard hat, it's ALWAYS pink."

characters.name:
Crystal Chalice Stand Pony
Amethyst Gleam
characters.description: Appears as a trader of crystal chalices at the Rainbow Falls Traders Exchange in Trade Ya!, voiced by Ashleigh Ball. Resembles "Cultivar" and Coco Pommel. Her cutie mark is a purple crystal formation. She is a character called "Crystal Chalice Trader" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This businesspony specializes in providing very expensive and incredibly delicate crystal chalices... in exchange for rusty old horseshoes. She has her reasons." She also appears in a promotional image posted by Hasbro's My Little Pony Facebook page.

characters.name:
Saddle Arabian Mare
Amira
characters.description: See Saddle Arabia delegates.

characters.name: Apple Bottom
characters.description: Appears during the song Raise This Barn in Apple Family Reunion, but is not included in any of the Apple family photos. Shares her design and eye color with S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, her design with S04E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #4, S02E03 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, and S06E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, her mane style and eye color with Apple Stars, Lemon Hearts, Lilac Hearts, and "Golden Glory", her mane style with Twinkleshine, her coat and mane colors and at least part of her cutie mark with Apple Cinnamon, and her coat and mane colors with "Red June".

characters.name:
Sunny Appleloosan
Apple Cherry
characters.description: Appears in Appleloosa in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. Shares her design and eye color with Berryshine and Berry Dreams, shares her design with Cherry Berry, shares her coat color and cutie mark with Apple Cobbler, and has a similar color scheme to Princess Glitter Punch. Her cutie mark is an apple brown betty. She is a character called "Sunny Appleloosan" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Apricot Bow
characters.description: Appears at the train station in Dodge Junction during The Last Roundup, being shown the picture of Applejack by Twilight Sparkle. Has the same design, cutie mark, and hat as Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, the same design and cutie mark design as Grape Delight, and the same design as Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles.

characters.name: Avalon
characters.description: One of Rarity's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models. Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 2.

characters.name:
Hyped-Up Dancer
Azure Velour
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a dancer in DJ Pon-3's dance club. Also depicted on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria card #32 R, Ravers, Glowsticks Optional. She is a character called "Hyped-Up Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the Presentable in Periwinkle event. The game's description of her states, "A regular fixture at her preferred club, she likes all of her 'steps' to begin with a 'dub.'"

characters.name: Barbara Banter
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, Shadow Play - Part 2, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and Daring Doubt and in Las Pegasus in Viva Las Pegasus and Grannies Gone Wild. Her cutie mark is an open book.

characters.name: Beauty Brass
characters.description: See Beauty Brass.

characters.name: Bell Perin
characters.description: Appears in Winter Wrap Up and My Little Pony The Movie. Has the same tail style and coat and mane colors as Lemon Hearts.

characters.name: Bella Brella
characters.description: A spa pony who appears at Ponyville's Day Spa in Filli Vanilli. Also appears in No Second Prances, in Applejack's "Day" Off, and on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #46 page 5. Her cutie mark is an umbrella.

characters.name: Belle Star
characters.description: Appears in Dodge Junction during The Last Roundup. Has the same design, eye and partly mane colors, and hat as Sweetie Drops. A similar pony appears without a hat on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #1 page 3/Dynamic Forces exclusive Cover RE.

characters.name:
Chummy Friendship Student
Berry Bliss
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The Hearth's Warming Club, The End in Friend, Road to Friendship, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, She's All Yak, Student Counsel, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, The Ending of the End - Part 2, The Last Problem, Teacher of the Month, Starlight the Hypnotist, the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 102 comic Underwater memories, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her design with S08E09 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Her cutie mark is three berries. She is a character called "Chummy Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Kelly Sheridan in Marks for Effort and Cathy Weseluck in School Raze.

characters.name: Berry Dreams
characters.description: See Iron Pony competition cheerleaders.

characters.name: Berry Frost
characters.description: Opens a window and joins the chorus of the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed. Shares the same design as "MjÃ¶lna" from the back and "Forest Spirit" and the same mane style as Rainbowshine, Orange Swirl, and Sugar Twist.

characters.name: Berry Icicle
characters.description: Is seen in Winter Wrap Up. Identical to Spring Forward in all but mane color. Her cutie mark is a few carrots.

characters.name: Berry Preppy
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Saddle Row Review, Shadow Play - Part 2, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Neigh Sayer share the latest fashions." Her cutie mark is a strawberry and bunch of grapes.

characters.name: Berryshine
characters.description: See Berryshine.

characters.name:
Cutting-Edge Shop-Pony
Betsey Trotson
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review and Fake It 'Til You Make It as a Rarity For You salespony. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. She is a character named "Cutting-Edge Shop-Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as a helper during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. Her bio states, "It takes ages for this 'Rarity for You' staffer to do her eyeliners right--but it's SO worth it." Her cutie mark is a red heart dripping red paint. Resembles fashion designer Betsey Johnson.

characters.name: Betty Hoof
characters.description: Appears in Dungeons & Discords as a jazz club patron dancing with S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4. Also appears in Sparkle's Seven. Bears a resemblance to Betty Boop.

characters.name: Biddy Broomtail
characters.description: Appears as a rodeo school judge in Trouble Shoes' flashback and in the present in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Fame and Misfortune and Growing Up is Hard to Do.

characters.name:
Big-Haired Bowler
Big Wig
characters.description: One of the bowlers in The Cutie Pox. Later appears with her mane and tail covered in parasprites in Leap of Faith, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, and in Slice of Life. Her cutie mark appears to be three jacks. She is named with a trademark symbol in the eleventh wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "is always ready to play a game!" She is a character called "Big-Haired Bowler" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Bitta Blues
characters.description: Appears during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride. Shares her design with Berryshine, Cherry Berry, and Berry Dreams. Her cutie mark is a ladybug.

characters.name: Blue Bonnet
characters.description: Appears once during the parasprite infestation of Ponyville in Swarm of the Century, cowering with her eyes closed. Has the same coat color and cutie mark as Shoeshine, the same mane and tail as Noteworthy, and the same mane and tail style and cutie mark design as S06E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3. Her cutie mark is two linked horseshoes.

characters.name: Blue Bows
characters.description: Seen in Ponyville Urgent Care during a pan shot in Applebuck Season. Seen again in Leap of Faith. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, shares her design and cutie mark design with Grape Delight, shares her design with Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles, and shares her color scheme with Diamond Mint.

characters.name: Blue Cutie
characters.description: One of Sapphire Shores' backup dancers in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. Also appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #37. A similar pony appears on the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #22 page 1. Has a similar color scheme to Star Swirl and "Mystery Mint".

characters.name: Blue Nile
characters.description: One of the Fashion Week competitors in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games and She's All Yak. Her cutie mark is a vanity mirror.

characters.name: Blueberry Curls
characters.description: See Blueberry Curls.

characters.name: Bonnie
characters.description: A mare seen during Granny Smith's sepia memories respectively in Family Appreciation Day in Canterlot and in Leap of Faith. Shares her design and at least the design of her cutie mark with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, shares at least the design of her cutie mark and mostly her color scheme with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #8, and shares her color scheme with "Turf". Her cutie mark appears to be a key.

characters.name: Bottlecap
characters.description: Seen in the crowd at Applejack's prize pony ceremony in Applebuck Season, sometimes with a different eye color in The Show Stoppers, with a cutie mark of two green bottles during Flim and Flam's song in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in Magic Duel, with a different cutie mark in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, with a cutie mark of three gemstones in Leap of Faith, with a cutie mark that switches between a lyre and a laurel wreath in Trade Ya!, in Honest Apple, in Non-Compete Clause, and in the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game. Shares the same design as "Mango Juice" and "Tropical Spring" and the same mane style as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", High Spirits, and Tropical Storm.

characters.name: Britneigh Spurs
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus depicted in poster at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Bears a resemblance to Britney Spears.

characters.name: Bulk Shipment
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a mail courier. Also appears in A Matter of Principals.

characters.name: Burning passion[sic]
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a booth at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, A Health of Information, Once Upon a Zeppelin, Grannies Gone Wild, and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever. Shares her design with S06E13 Unnamed Earth Mare #9 and S08E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and sometimes her design and eye color with S06E13 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a red flame.

characters.name: Butter Pop
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design with Apple Brown Betty, and resembles Fizzypop, G1 Caramel Crunch, and G3 Butter Pop. Her cutie mark is popcorn or a float.

characters.name: Buzzsaw McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is a circular saw.

characters.name: Candy Curls
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as one of three delegate ponies at Princess Luna's luncheon. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1.

characters.name: Candy Mane
characters.description: See Candy Mane.

characters.name: Candy Twirl
characters.description: First appears in Family Appreciation Day, both in Granny Smith's sepia memory and queuing up in the present day for zap apple jam. Later appears several times in the line for the Apples' cider in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. Appears again in a flashback in Apple Family Reunion and in another flashback in Leap of Faith. Also appears in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #8 page 10. Shares her design with "Maribelle". Her cutie mark is three spools of red string.

characters.name: Carlotta
characters.description: Appears in The Best Night Ever, Sweet and Elite, Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 1, and Make New Friends but Keep Discord.

characters.name: Cascada
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a booth at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus and Once Upon a Zeppelin. Her cutie mark is a waterfall.

characters.name:
Traveling Mare
Cathy O'Mara
characters.description: See Homebound Ponies.

characters.name:
Magical Pony
Celena
characters.description: See Sailor Moon ponies.

characters.name: Charcoal Bakes
characters.description: Appears in Hearth's Warming Eve, both during the pageant performance and backstage after it ends. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 2 and the IDW comics' My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #5 page 4. Her cutie mark is three cupcakes.

characters.name: Charged Up
characters.description: See Iron Pony competition cheerleaders.

characters.name: Cherry Berry
characters.description: See Cherry Berry.

characters.name: Cherry Jumble
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever selling jars of jelly at the Rainbow Falls Hearth's Warming Craft Fair.

characters.name: Cherry Punch
characters.description: Seen in Ponyville Urgent Care during two shots in Applebuck Season, sick and with her face hidden. Seen again in Leap of Faith, sick and with her eyes closed. Also appears on the IDW comics' My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #1 regular cover, well and with her eyes open. Resembles Cherry Berry and Berryshine. Her cutie mark is a pair of cherries. Unlike most mares, she appears to be eyelashless, though she had eyelashes in early concept art.

characters.name:
Runway Model
Chic Flower
characters.description: Appears in Fake It 'Til You Make It as Rarity's model at the Canterlot Royal Fashion Show. Resembles Issue 22 Unnamed Mare - Lightning Bolt and to a lesser extent Fluttershy. She is a character named "Runway Model" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game bio states "One of Rarity's go-to clothesponies whenever the Canterlot Royal Fashion Show rolls around."

characters.name: Chilly Puddle
characters.description: Stands next to S01E03 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 during Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master, watches the talent show in The Show Stoppers, talks with S01E03 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, and has her cutie mark visible in Simple Ways. Shares the same design as "Purple Haze", Green Jewel, "Welly", and S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and the same mane style as Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", "Graceful Falls", "Downdraft", and Honey Rays. Her cutie mark appears to be two dolphins. A November 6, 2013 "vorlÃ¤ufige Abbildung" image for mystery packs includes her, without her cutie mark.

characters.name: Chimney Dust
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tail". Her cutie mark is a chimney and sweep.

characters.name:
Food Merchant
Chock-full Carafe
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan selling popcorn in Made in Manehattan and The Gift of the Maud Pie. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Grannies Gone Wild, and The Last Problem. Her cutie mark is a coffee cup. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Cinnamon Pear
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear as a member of the Pear family. Her cutie mark is half of a pear and a stick of cinnamon.

characters.name:
Jeweler Pony
Clarity Cut
characters.description: Appears in All Bottled Up and Dragon Dropped as a Ponyville jeweler. She shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1 and her color scheme and occupation with Karat. Her cutie mark is two diamond earrings. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name:
Well-Dressed Somnambulan
Cleo Saraj
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? as a resident of Somnambula. Also appears in Road to Friendship and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. She is a character called "Well-Dressed Somnambulan" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Cleopatra Jazz
characters.description: Appears in Dungeons & Discords as a jazz club patron or employee. Also appears in Sparkle's Seven. Her cutie mark is three bananas.

characters.name: Cobalt Shade
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, and during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride.

characters.name: Coral Shine
characters.description: One of Suri Polomare's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie and on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 Books-A-Million cover RE. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Cornflower
characters.description: Appears at the train station in Dodge Junction during The Last Roundup, being shown the picture of Applejack by Twilight Sparkle. Has the same design, cutie mark, and hat as Daisy.

characters.name: Crescendo
characters.description: Appears four times at once during Behold, Princess Twilight Sparkle in Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Issue 22 Unnamed Mare - Lightning Bolt, the same mane style as Fluttershy, "Parula", and Diamond Rose, and the same eye style as Rarity and Lotus Blossom.

characters.name: Creamcup
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design and eye color with Candy Apples, "Peach Melba", S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #11, and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #23, and shares her design with "Jinx".

characters.name: Crimson Skate
characters.description: Appears in The Cart Before the Ponies participating in the Applewood Derby alongside "Train Tracks". Her cutie mark is a skateboard.

characters.name: Crosscut McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is a hand saw. Shares her color scheme with "Hacksaw McColt".

characters.name: Cultivar
characters.description: Appears in Leap of Faith covered in bandages, in Equestria Games, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, in Newbie Dash, in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, in Where the Apple Lies, in The Perfect Pear, in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, in The Beginning of the End - Part 2, in The Point of No Return, in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Spring Breakdown, in She Talks to Angel, and in A Horse Shoe-In. A unicorn version with a different coat color appears in Princess Spike, The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, School Daze - Part 1, Yakity-Sax, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, and The Point of No Return. Resembles Nurse Snowheart in color scheme and eye style, and shares her coat and eye colors with Sweetie Drops, Fine Line, Press Release, "Roma", "Paisley Pastel", S05E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, and "Hazel Harvest". Her cutie mark is a blue flower and two smaller red flowers.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.description: See Daisy.

characters.name: Dane Tee Dove
characters.description: See Dane Tee Dove.

characters.name:
Police Pony
Deputy Copper
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie as a Manehattan police officer. She is named in the twenty-fourth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Deputy Copper, "She helps her friends solve mysteries." Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Her cutie mark is a gold police badge. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Doctor Pinkheart
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a doctor/surgeon at the Ponyville Hospital.

characters.name: Doseydotes
characters.description: Runs around in panic after Nightmare Moon leaves in Friendship is Magic, part 2. Later appears in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #8 page 13. Wears a peach-orange flower in her mane. Her design is the same as that of Roku-chan, her mane and tail style is the same as that of Rainbow Dash, Daring Do, Holly Dash, Skywishes, Sugar Grape, Lucky Dreams, Sweetsong, Breezie, Feathermay, "Ballad", Periwinkle, Star Dasher, LÃ©on, and sometimes Ploomette and Banana Bliss, her mane style is the same as that of Andrea, her tail style is the same as that of "Sunstone" and WCE Unnamed Mare - Jouster, and her color scheme and flower are the same as those of Prim Posy. The included image is slightly dark.

characters.name: Dosie Dough
characters.description: Appears during the song Raise This Barn in Apple Family Reunion, but is not included in any of the Apple family photos. Resembles "Cinnabelle". Shares the coat and mane colors of "Apple Top".

characters.name: Dry Wheat
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, at the home of the Earth ponies and at the summit of the tribes.

characters.name: Eclair CrÃ¨me
characters.description: See Eclair CrÃ¨me.

characters.name: Elphaba Trot
characters.description: Opens a window and joins the chorus of the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed.

characters.name:
Sleek Pony
Ever Essence
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident and perfume seller in Sire's Hollow. She is a character called "Essence Salespony" in Gameloft's mobile game. Not one of the Sailor Moon ponies, "just designed to look hip and modern" according to Jim Miller. Voiced by Jinjara Mitchell.

characters.name: Fiddly Twang
characters.description: See Fiddly Twang.

characters.name:
Athletic Dancer
Flashdancer
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a dancer in DJ Pon-3's dance club. Also appears in My Little Pony Established 1983 "Pinkercise w/ Pinkie Pie!" Her cutie mark is a yellow star. Also depicted on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria card #32 R, Ravers, Glowsticks Optional. She is a character called "Athletic Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the Presentable in Periwinkle eventgame's description of her states, "Those sweatbands declare she's ready for action -- to dance the whole night is her main satisfaction!"-->

characters.name: Floral Pan
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a cooking pan with a floral pattern.

characters.name: Flounder
characters.description: Appears in Friendship is Magic, part 1, in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in Applebuck Season, in Boast Busters, in Winter Wrap Up, in The Show Stoppers, in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in A Friend in Deed, in The Crystal Empire - Part 1, in The Crystal Empire - Part 2, in Magic Duel, in Apple Family Reunion, with a cutie mark of two hearts in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, with a cutie mark that switches between three raindrops and two flowers in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, with a cutie mark of a horseshoe in Leap of Faith, with a cutie mark that switches between a leaf and an umbrella in Trade Ya!, with a cutie mark of a wand and a moon in Honest Apple, and in the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game. Shares her design with "Lavenderhoof" and her color scheme with Lemon Hearts. Tinted blue in the included image.

characters.name: Flurry
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, at the beginning of the play, at the home of the Earth ponies, and at the summit of the tribes. Also appears in flashback in Shadow Play - Part 2.

characters.name: Forest Spirit
characters.description: Appears in The Ticket Master, in The Show Stoppers, in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, in Simple Ways, with a visible cutie mark that switches between what appears to be a conifer and what appears to be an umbrella in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, and with a visible cutie mark of two hearts in Honest Apple. Shares the same design as "MjÃ¶lna" from the back and "Berry Frost" and the same mane style as Rainbowshine, Orange Swirl, and Sugar Twist.

characters.name:
Nerdy Delegate
Frazzle Rock
characters.description: Appears as one of the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike and again briefly in Canterlot Boutique. Shares her body model and eye color with S08E01 Unnamed Earth Mare #0 and her body model with "Feather Twirl" and S07E19 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Her cutie mark is three sheets of paper. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. She is a character called "Studious Delegate" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This studious pony sure knows how to tally -- when it comes to academics, she does not dillydally."

characters.name: Frou Frou
characters.description: Her mane got ruined in The Show Stoppers, after the Cutie Mark Crusaders dye and style it like a clown's wig. Her cutie mark is a pink lotus blossom.

characters.name: Glitter Spritz
characters.description: Appears in Honest Apple as the model for Starstreak's fashions in the Carousel Boutique fashion contest. Her cutie mark is a blue hairbrush, red hair pick, and pink comb.

characters.name:
Demure Pony
Golden Harvest
characters.description: See Golden Harvest.

characters.name: Gorgeous Glamour
characters.description: One of Rarity's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie and Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 2. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Grape Delight
characters.description: Appears in Suited For Success, The Cutie Mark Chronicles, and Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 3. Identical to Lilac Links in all but eye color and cutie mark, shares her design and coat color with Luckette, shares her design and cutie mark design with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, and shares her design with Shoeshine and Sunny Smiles. A mini-figure toy and a collector card of her are packaged together as part of the ninth wave of mystery packs. According to the card, she "thinks fruity treats are delicious!" Her name comes both from the card and from the packaging of the wave, which each list the name as a trademark.

characters.name: Green Jewel
characters.description: See Green Jewel.

characters.name: Greenhoof Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1.

characters.name: Hacksaw McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is a bow saw. Shares her color scheme with "Crosscut McColt". Voiced by Ellen Kennedy.

characters.name: Hazel Harvest
characters.description: Briefly appears in a hazmat suit during The Cutie Pox. Shares her design and mane color with Golden Harvest and Caramel Apple and her coat and eye colors with Sweetie Drops, Fine Line, Press Release, "Roma", "Paisley Pastel", "Cultivar", and S05E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1.

characters.name:
Sandbar's Mom
High Tide
characters.description: Appears in The Hearth's Warming Club as Sandbar's mother in his story. Also appears in The Ending of the End - Part 2. Her cutie mark is a seashell. She is a character called "Sandbar's Mom" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her bio states, "Sandbar often talks about the time he almost spilled grape juice on her couch--but she's just relieved he didn't ACTUALLY do it."

characters.name: Hilly Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Also appears in A Royal Problem. Shares her body type and coat color with Sapphire Shores and her body type with "Zen Moment".

characters.name: Hinny of the Hills
characters.description: The actress portraying Hinny in the Bridleway musical Hinny of the Hills in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears on the season 4 poster. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Hoda Kotb
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Hoda Kotb. Her cutie mark is a pink baby rattle.

characters.name: Honey Dew
characters.description: Appears at the twelfth annual Ponyville turkey call during Big McIntosh's flashback in Filli Vanilli. Resembles Peachy Pie in color scheme.

characters.name:
Registration Pony
Janine Manewitz
characters.description: Appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan as the Fashion Week receptionist. Later appears in Equestria Games and Made in Manehattan with her cutie mark visible. Also appears on the season 4 poster. Her cutie mark is a blue quill. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. Based on Grace from Ferris Bueller's Day Off and named after Janine Melnitz from Ghostbusters. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Joan Pommelway share a hot chocolate."

characters.name:
Salespony
Jasmine Leaf
characters.description: Appears in Discordant Harmony as a tea shop owner in Ponyville. Also appears in Common Ground. Her cutie mark is three green tea leaves fanned over a white and lavender mug. She is a character called "Teashop Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "A true connoisseur when it comes to her teas -- even difficult customers are sure to be pleased!" Voiced by Kelly Sheridan.

characters.name: Jinx
characters.description: Appears in Leap of Faith with a bandaged head and in a wheelchair, in Equestria Games, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, in Parental Glideance, and on My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 page 7. Shares her design with Candy Apples, "Peach Melba", "Creamcup", S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #11, and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #23. Her cutie mark is a horseshoe. Voiced by Ashleigh Ball.

characters.name: Joan Pommelway
characters.description: See Mad Men ponies.

characters.name: Jorunn
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as a resident of Rockhoof's village in Applejack's story.

characters.name: Jubileena
characters.description: Appears during one shot in Too Many Pinkie Pies, standing near the sign outside the Golden Oak Library. Also appears on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #7 page 2. Her design and eye color are the same as those of Cherry Berry, and her cutie mark, six cherries in pairs, is three of hers. She bears a resemblance to G1 Cherries Jubilee; see also Cherry Jubilee.

characters.name: Kathie Lee Gifford
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Kathie Lee Gifford. Her cutie mark is the Today Show logo.

characters.name: Lady Beetle
characters.description: A mare who appears at a table with "Spring Green" in Somepony to Watch Over Me. Her color scheme is similar to those of Florina Tart and Minty.

characters.name: Lady Gaval
characters.description: See Lady Gaval.

characters.name: Lavender August
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design with Cherry Berry, Berryshine, and Berry Dreams.

characters.name: Lavender Bloom
characters.description: See Lavender Bloom.

characters.name: Lavender Blush
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, and during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride.

characters.name: Lavender Essence
characters.description: A spa pony who appears at Ponyville's Day Spa in No Second Prances and Applejack's "Day" Off. Also appears in She Talks to Angel. Her cutie mark is two candles. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Lavenderhoof
characters.description: Appears in Applebuck Season, in Boast Busters, in Winter Wrap Up, in The Show Stoppers, in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, with a visible cutie mark in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in A Friend in Deed, in Magic Duel, in Pinkie Pride, with a visible cutie mark of a wand and a moon in Simple Ways, with a visible cutie mark of two hearts in both It Ain't Easy Being Breezies and Leap of Faith, with a visible cutie mark of a scroll in Trade Ya!, with a visible cutie mark of a leaf in Honest Apple, and in the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game. Shares the same design as "Flounder".

characters.name: Lemon Chiffon
characters.description: A passenger of a carriage bus that is stopped from careening off a cliff by Mare Do Well in The Mysterious Mare Do Well. Later appears in Manehattan, including on a cruise ship, in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, in Made in Manehattan, in Fame and Misfortune with a speaking role, in Shadow Play - Part 2, in Grannies Gone Wild, in Molt Down, in Between Dark and Dawn, in Growing Up is Hard to Do, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is sometimes two hearts, other times a cup of water, and still other times two dolphins. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Lilac Blossom
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Golden Harvest. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Lilac Links
characters.description: See Lilac Links.

characters.name:
Meadowbrook's Mother
Lilac Meadow
characters.description: Appears in A Health of Information as Mage Meadowbrook's mother. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. She is a character named "Mage Meadowbrook's Mom" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game bio states "Even Pillars of Old Equestria love their mamas--and that definitely includes Hayseed Swamp's finest healer!" Voiced by Brenda Crichlow.

characters.name: Lily Valley
characters.description: See Lily Valley.

characters.name: Linked Hearts
characters.description: She is shown chasing after Twilight Sparkle's doll, Smarty Pants, in Lesson Zero. Has the same design and cutie mark as Shoeshine, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles and a similar color scheme to White Lightning. Her cutie mark is two linked horseshoes.

characters.name: Little Po
characters.description: Found behind Spike in Rarity's fashion show in Suited For Success, with a flower in her mane. Shares her mane style and flower design with Virgo.

characters.name: Long Shot
characters.description: See Paparazzi ponies.

characters.name: Luckette
characters.description: See Luckette.

characters.name: Lucky Star
characters.description: See Iron Pony competition cheerleaders.

characters.name: Lyrica Lilac
characters.description: See Lyrica Lilac.

characters.name: Magenta Surf
characters.description: One of Sapphire Shores' backup dancers in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. Also appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #37, and in a photograph in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Has a similar color scheme to "Surf" and S09E23 Unnamed Earth Mare #1.

characters.name: Majesty
characters.description: Appears in The Best Night Ever. On My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #5 page 8 and Issue #6 page 14, she appears in nightmares that Pinkie Pie has. Shares the same design as Lyrica Lilac and Purple Wave. Her cutie mark is a lyre.

characters.name: Manely Gold
characters.description: Tends to a garden patch that gets eaten by the parasprites in Swarm of the Century, with a darker coat than in later episodes. Operates a news stand in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Trade Ya! She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Lyra Heartstrings enjoy time at the spa." Her cutie mark is a flower.

characters.name: Mango Juice
characters.description: Appears in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in Boast Busters, with her cutie mark visible in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, in Trade Ya!, and in Saved by My Friends. Her cutie mark is a pair of cherries. Shares the same design as "Bottlecap" and "Tropical Spring" and the same mane style as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", High Spirits, and Tropical Storm. Tinted yellow.

characters.name:
Whinnyapolis Delegate
March Gustysnows
characters.description: Appears as the Whinnyapolis delegate for the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 3. Her cutie mark is a cup of coffee. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. She is a character called "Whinnyapolis Delegate" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Whinnyapolis gets really cold in the snow -- but this pony still loves her home, don'tcha know!" Fluffy Clouds' Enterplay collectible card game High Magic expansion set card #26 R attributes to Manehattan Delegate and Whinnyapolis Delegate the respective quotes "What city is he even representing?" and "Gosh, I don't think even HE knows that."

characters.name: Mare E. Belle
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, with a different cutie mark at Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, in Canterlot in Canterlot Boutique, and in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Saddle Row Review, Shadow Play - Part 2, Fake It 'Til You Make It, She's All Yak, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Shares her design with Silver Berry, Berryshine, Berry Dreams, and Cherry Berry. Her cutie mark usually is three bows and rarely is a drum set. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Mare E. Lynn love beautiful accessories."

characters.name: Mare E. Lynn
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, behind Photo Finish and Sapphire Shores. Also appears at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, with a different design at Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, in Made in Manehattan, in The Gift of the Maud Pie, in The Saddle Row Review, in Fake It 'Til You Make It, and in an animated Today Show video. Her cutie mark is a pink horseshoe and another horseshoe interlocked. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Silver Berry wear super-cute hats and bows."

characters.name: Maribelle
characters.description: Appears in a flashback in Bats!, as one of the actresses in the Bridleway musical Hinny of the Hills in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Granny Smith's flashback in Leap of Faith, and in a flashback in No Second Prances. Shares her design with "Candy Twirl". Her cutie mark is three spools of orange thread.

characters.name: Maroon Carrot
characters.description: Shares her design with Golden Harvest. Her cutie mark is a few carrots.

characters.name: Masquerade
characters.description: See Masquerade.

characters.name: Maybelline
characters.description: A passenger of a carriage bus that is stopped from careening off a cliff by Mare Do Well in The Mysterious Mare Do Well. Later appears in Manehattan, including on a cruise ship, in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, Made in Manehattan, The Crystalling - Part 1, Growing Up is Hard to Do, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8.

characters.name: Meadowluck
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review at Rarity For You's grand opening. Her cutie mark is a silver horseshoe.

characters.name: Midnight Fun
characters.description: One of Photo Finish's assistants in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Sweet and Elite, Rarity Takes Manehattan, Equestria Games, Honest Apple, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Vidala Swoon always look their best." Named after an original character of "Madmax". Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Millie
characters.description: Appears in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, emitting the same scream as Rarity and later receiving the rescued Cream Puff from Rainbow Dash. Also appears with "Dinky Doo" and Cotton Cloudy in Spike at Your Service. Appears again in Pinkie Pride, Flutter Brutter, The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, Where the Apple Lies, The Perfect Pear, Triple Threat, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, The Maud Couple, Horse Play, Non-Compete Clause, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, The Summer Sun Setback, Dragon Dropped, A Horse Shoe-In, Growing Up is Hard to Do, and The Big Mac Question. Shares her mane and tail with S06E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is three fans.

characters.name: Mint Swirl
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Golden Harvest and a similar color scheme to S04E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #4 and S06E07 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Minty
characters.description: See Minty.

characters.name:
Bookstore Pony 2
Minty Mocha
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident and bookstore owner in Sire's Hollow. Voiced by Jennifer Copping.

characters.name: Mixed Berry
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident of Sire's Hollow.

characters.name: MjÃ¶lna
characters.description: See MjÃ¶lna.

characters.name: Morning Glory
characters.description: Appears in Honest Apple as the model for Lily Lace's fashions in the Carousel Boutique fashion contest. Has a similar color scheme to Tealove.

characters.name:
Mother Pony
Mrs. Paleo
characters.description: See Paleo family.

characters.name:
Executive Producer/Story Editor
Nicole Dubuc
characters.description: Appears in Between Dark and Dawn. An original character of Nicole Dubuc's.

characters.name: Nurse Magenta Heart
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a nurse pony at the Ponyville Hospital.

characters.name: Nurse Snowheart
characters.description: See Nurse ponies.

characters.name: Nurse Sweetheart
characters.description: See Nurse ponies.

characters.name: Nurse Tenderheart
characters.description: See Nurse ponies.

characters.name: Oakey Doke
characters.description: Seen in Friendship is Magic, part 1, Applebuck Season, Boast Busters, Winter Wrap Up, Suited For Success, The Show Stoppers, The Cutie Mark Chronicles, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Hearts and Hooves Day, A Friend in Deed, A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, The Crystal Empire - Part 1, The Crystal Empire - Part 2, Magic Duel, Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2, Pinkie Pride, Simple Ways, Filli Vanilli, It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, Leap of Faith, Trade Ya!, Equestria Games, Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2, Honest Apple, and the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game, always from behind except for some shots during The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Equestria Games, and Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. She shares her design with Berryshine and Cherry Berry. Her cutie mark is three ferns.

characters.name: Obscurity
characters.description: A pony seen in the crowd during the first fashion show in Suited For Success.

characters.name: Ocean Dream
characters.description: Seen at the Ponyville Day Spa in Filli Vanilli, Applejack's "Day" Off, and All Bottled Up. Her cutie mark is sometimes a palm tree and other times a strawberry and bunch of grapes.

characters.name: Ocean Spray
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Grannies Gone Wild, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8.

characters.name: Octavia Melody
characters.description: See Octavia Melody.

characters.name: Offbeat
characters.description: Appears, at least sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, Rock Solid Friendship, and a European magazine comic whose French title is Une leÃ§on d'amitiÃ©. Her cutie mark appears to be partly shown in the comic.â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹ A similar pony appears on Friendship is Magic Issue #48 page 15.

characters.name: Orange Sherbet
characters.description: One of Suri Polomare's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games and on a friendly blind date with S05E16 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7 in The Gift of the Maud Pie. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models. Shares her mane style and color with S05E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #6.

characters.name:
Ecstatic Dancer
Pacific Glow
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a dancer in DJ Pon-3's dance club. Her cutie mark is three glow sticks. She is named on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria card #32 R, Ravers, Glowsticks Optional, which attributes to her the quote "But PLUR is never optional!" She is a character called "Ecstatic Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the Presentable in Periwinkle event. The game's description of her states, "This mare is a maniac out on the floor -- it's a wonder she doesn't dance right out the door!"

characters.name: Paisley Pastel
characters.description: Appears in Granny Smith's sepia memory during Family Appreciation Day, departs the Friendship Express train from Manehattan to Ponyville at the beginning of One Bad Apple, appears in Granny Smith's flashback in Leap of Faith, appears with a different design in Trouble Shoes' flashback in Appleoosa's Most Wanted, and appears in a flashback in No Second Prances. Shares her design with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Mare #3, and shares her coat and eye colors with Sweetie Drops, Fine Line, Press Release, "Roma", "Cultivar", S05E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, and "Hazel Harvest". Her cutie mark is three paisley designs.

characters.name: Pampered Pearl
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Lyrica Lilac and Purple Wave. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Peach Melba
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design and eye color with Candy Apples, "Creamcup", S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #11, and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #23, and shares her design with "Jinx".

characters.name: Peachy Cream
characters.description: Appears in The Last Roundup at the arena, shaking her head when asked about Applejack's whereabouts. In the IDW comics, she appears on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #12's Hot Topic cover.

characters.name: Peachy Plume
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a front desk receptionist at the Ponyville Hospital.

characters.name:
Pony Shopper
Pearmain Worcester
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Saddle Row Review, and Daring Doubt and in Las Pegasus in Viva Las Pegasus. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a heart-shaped apple. Voiced by Ashleigh Ball.

characters.name: Pegasus Olsen
characters.description: See Mad Men ponies.

characters.name: Penny Ante
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Shares her design with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #12. Her cutie mark is three aces.

characters.name: Perfume Hearts
characters.description: One of Suri Polomare's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, in Made in Manehattan, in The Gift of the Maud Pie, and on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 Books-A-Million cover RE. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Picture Frame
characters.description: Appears in Green Isn't Your Color, Sweet and Elite, Rarity Takes Manehattan, Honest Apple, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Powder Rouge are always in style." Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Pitch Perfect
characters.description: A harmonica player from Luna Eclipsed, Apple Family Reunion, a picture in Pinkie Apple Pie, and A Hearth's Warming Tail. Also appears in an October 31, 2013 promotional image. Shares the same design as Beauty Brass. Strongly resembles "Honey Drop".

characters.name: Play Write
characters.description: A teacher at the Ponyville Schoolhouse in Rarity's flashback in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, with a speaking role. She later appears in Trade Ya! and Equestria Games. Her cutie mark is three pencils.

characters.name: Posey Petals
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design and mane and eye colors with Apple Bumpkin, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #12, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark design with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #4, shares her design and eye color with Perfect Pie and "Sun Streak", and shares her design with "Sunfire". Her cutie mark is two flowers.

characters.name: Powder Rouge
characters.description: One of the ponies who readies Fluttershy for the fashion show under Photo Finish's command in Green Isn't Your Color. Later appears in Equestria Games. Her narrow eyes widen right before Fluttershy sneezes in the former episode. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Lyrica Lilac like pretty jewelry."

characters.name: Power Chord
characters.description: Appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin as a passenger on Iron Will's Cruise of the Princesses Experience. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild and The Washouts. Shares her design and eye color with S07E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #1 and her mane and tail style and eye color with "Soaring Virtue", and resembles S05E25 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #3. Her cutie mark is a guitar.

characters.name: Pretty Vision
characters.description: A pony in a green suit who is part of Photo Finish's entourage in Green Isn't Your Color. She excitedly cheers for Fluttershy at her fashion show. Also appears in Sweet and Elite, Rarity Takes Manehattan, Honest Apple, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Roxie Rave offer to help on the runway."

characters.name: Purple Haze
characters.description: Appears during Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master and has her varying cutie mark visible in Simple Ways. Shares the same design as "Chilly Puddle", Green Jewel, "Welly", and S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and the same mane style as Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", "Graceful Falls", "Downdraft", and Honey Rays. Her cutie mark is sometimes what appears to be a pair of cherries.

characters.name: Purple Wave
characters.description: See Purple Wave.

characters.name: Pursey Pink
characters.description: See Pursey Pink.

characters.name:
Masseuse Pony
Quake
characters.description: Works as a masseuse at Ponyville's Day Spa in Green Isn't Your Color and Ponyville Confidential. A unicorn version, male according to Rebecca Dart, gives Spike a massage in Princess Spike. Her/his cutie mark is two hearts - one pink, one red. She is a playable character called "Masseuse Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, which depicts her as an Earth pony and gives her the description "A competent masseuse from the spa; hard-working and confident."

characters.name:
Method Mare 2
Raspberry Beret
characters.description: See Method Mares.

characters.name: Raspberry Glaze
characters.description: Appears as a competitor in the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. She shares her design with Apple Fritter, Jonagold, Lavender Fritter, S04E26 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #10, and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #15. Her cutie mark is two donuts.

characters.name:
Clerk
Raspberry Vinaigrette
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie as a passenger on the Friendship Express. Also appears in Buckball Season, with a speaking role as a store clerk in Discordant Harmony, in The Parent Map, and in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. Shares her design with S08E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #1 and her body design with S09E26 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #3. She is a character called "Judgy Clerk Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as an enemy minion during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event. The game's description of her states, "Though her customers put her aplomb to the test -- despite her annoyance, she's doing her best!" Her cutie mark is a bottle and bowl. Voiced by Nicole Oliver.

characters.name: Raven Inkwell
characters.description: See Raven Inkwell.

characters.name: Reflective Rock
characters.description: Stands at a table in the VIP section in The Best Night Ever. Shares the same design as Lyrica Lilac and Purple Wave. Her cutie mark is a lyre.

characters.name: Regal Candent
characters.description: Member of Photo Finish's crew, stands in the audience at Fluttershy's first fashion show in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Sweet and Elite, at Fashion Week in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Equestria Games, and in She's All Yak. In Fake It 'Til You Make It, her silhouettes appear in a shot visually re-used from Green Isn't Your Color. Her cutie mark appears to be two linked horseshoes.

characters.name: Rogue Ruby
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention cosplaying as Dr. Caballeron.

characters.name: Rose
characters.description: See Rose.

characters.name: Rosemary
characters.description: Appears, cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1 and The Cutie Map - Part 2.

characters.name: Rosetta
characters.description: Appears in Brotherhooves Social as one of the Sisterhooves Social judges. Also appears in Rarity's flashback in The Cart Before the Ponies and at the Ponyville Hospital in Where the Apple Lies. Her cutie mark is a flower and two leaves.

characters.name: Rosy Riveter
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is three bolts. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Roxie Rave
characters.description: Wardrobe pony that is part of Photo Finish's entourage. She also appears in A Friend in Deed behind the counter of the Ponyville Day Spa. She later appears in Equestria Games and on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #46 page 5. Has a similar color scheme to Autumn Gem and "Aqua Blossom", and shares her cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Stella Lashes have fun with makeup."

characters.name: Ruby Splash
characters.description: See Ruby Splash.

characters.name: Salt Water
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at Canterlot in Amending Fences and Canterlot Boutique, and at Ponyville in Fame and Misfortune. Shares her design and eye color with Gala Appleby and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #18, shares her design with Apple Honey and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #20, and shares her mane style with S01E16 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1. Her cutie mark is three drops of water.

characters.name: Savannah Guthrie
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Savannah Guthrie. Her cutie mark is a microphone.

characters.name: Screwball
characters.description: See Screwball.

characters.name: Screwy
characters.description: See Screwy.

characters.name: Seasong
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, and during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride.

characters.name: Serena
characters.description: See Serena.

characters.name: Shoeshine
characters.description: See Shoeshine.

characters.name: Silver Berry
characters.description: See Silver Berry.

characters.name: Silver Frames
characters.description: See Fancy Pants' entourage.

characters.name: Sky View
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success and during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed.

characters.name:
Reporter Pony
Snappy Scoop
characters.description: See Paparazzi ponies.

characters.name: Soft Spot
characters.description: Appears in Equestria Games, next to "Princess Erroria", whose ears she covers. Shares her design and outfit design with Lavender Bloom and S04E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, shares her mane and tail style with "Ivy Vine", and shares her tail style with Golden Harvest. Her cutie mark is of at least two hearts.

characters.name: Soigne Folio
characters.description: One of Photo Finish's helpers in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Sweet and Elite. Later appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan, Equestria Games, Honest Apple, and She's All Yak. In Fake It 'Til You Make It, her silhouette appears in a shot visually re-used from Green Isn't Your Color. Resembles Violet Blurr, one of the humans associated with human Photo Finish. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Midnight Fun style each other's hair." Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Soot Stain
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, with magenta eyes at the home of the Earth ponies and with violet eyes at the summit of the tribes.

characters.name: Spaceage Sparkle
characters.description: One of the Fashion Week competitors in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games and She's All Yak. Her cutie mark is a pincushion.

characters.name: Spring Forward
characters.description: See Spring Forward.

characters.name:
Customer Pony
Spring Green
characters.description: A mare who appears at a table with "Lady Beetle" in Somepony to Watch Over Me. Also appears in Fame and Misfortune, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Voiced by Kazumi Evans in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You.

characters.name: Spring Harvest
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear. Shares her design with Octavia Melody and Fiddly Twang and her cutie mark with "Dirtbound". Her cutie mark is a carrot.

characters.name: Spring Water
characters.description: Sings in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, shares her design and cutie mark design with Grape Delight, and shares her design with Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles.

characters.name:
Method Mare 4
Stardom
characters.description: See Method Mares.

characters.name: Stella Lashes
characters.description: Part of Photo Finish's entourage from Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears at the gallery in Sweet and Elite, at Fashion Week in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Equestria Games, in Honest Apple, in Fake It 'Til You Make It, in She's All Yak, and on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #4 page 8. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Pretty Vision like new hairstyles." Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Strawberry Ice
characters.description: See Strawberry Ice.

characters.name:
Fancy Friendship Student
Strawberry Scoop
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Grannies Gone Wild, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The End in Friend, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, Sparkle's Seven, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, A Horse Shoe-In, The Last Problem, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her mane and tail style with "Sunshine Smiles" and S09E26 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is an ice cream cone. She is a character called "Fancy Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "This pony's mane may have natural highlights, but she's not self-possessed about it -- or much else, really.
